maml:description.maml:para: Closes any open handles locking a particular file/folder
Closes any open handles locking a particular file/folder. This function uses the sysinternals command line utility handle to do this, and acts as a wrapper for the tool.
The path to the file/folder whose open handles should be closed
The path to the actual handle executable that the function should use.
If this parameter is present, the function will download the handle executable from the sysinternals website to the default path specified in the "path" parameter.
If present, will automatically accept the End user license agreement when handle is run.
If present, will remove the handle executable from the computer after its task is complete.
The path to the file/folder whose open handles should be closed
The path to the actual handle executable that the function should use.
If this parameter is present, the function will download the handle executable from the sysinternals website to the default path specified in the "path" parameter.
If present, will automatically accept the End user license agreement when handle is run.
If present, will remove the handle executable from the computer after its task is complete.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Closes any open handles for the folder "needtodelete" in the user's "Documents" directory and all recursive items within it using the handle executable that is either in the current working directory or is in a directory that is a member of the system's "PATH" environment variable and will suppress the handle's End user license agreement.

Downloads the handle executable from the sysinternals website, extracts it to the default path (C:\temp), suppresses the end user license agreement prompt, and removes the executable from the system after its task is complete.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads and installs the correct version of the Windows Remote Server Administration Tools on the user's computer
Downloads and installs the correct version of the Windows Remote Server Administration Tools on the user's computer

maml:introduction.maml:para: Install the Remote server administration tools on local computer

maml:description.maml:para: Generates a random cryptography key.
Generates a random cryptography key based on the desired key size.
Algorithm to generate key for.
Number of bits the generated key will have.
Returns a String instead of SecureString.
Algorithm to generate key for.
Number of bits the generated key will have.
Returns a String instead of SecureString.

dev:type.maml:name: System.Security.SecureString. New-CryptographyKey return the key as a SecureString by default. System.String. New-CryptographyKey will return the key in plain text as a string if the -AsPlainText parameter is specified.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example generates a random 256-bit AES key and stores it in the variable $key.

maml:description.maml:para: Encrypts a file using a symmetrical algorithm.
Encrypts a file using a symmetrical algorithm.
File(s) to be encrypted.
Cryptography key as a SecureString to be used for encryption.
Specifies the block cipher mode to use for encryption.
Specifies the type of padding to apply when the message data block is shorter than the full number of bytes needed for a cryptographic operation.
Suffix of the encrypted file to be removed.
Removes the source (decrypted) file after encrypting.
File(s) to be encrypted.
Cryptography key as a String to be used for encryption.
Specifies the block cipher mode to use for encryption.
Specifies the type of padding to apply when the message data block is shorter than the full number of bytes needed for a cryptographic operation.
Suffix of the encrypted file to be removed.
Removes the source (decrypted) file after encrypting.
File(s) to be encrypted.
Cryptography key as a SecureString to be used for encryption.
Specifies the block cipher mode to use for encryption.
Specifies the type of padding to apply when the message data block is shorter than the full number of bytes needed for a cryptographic operation.
Suffix of the encrypted file to be removed.
Removes the source (decrypted) file after encrypting.
Cryptography key as a String to be used for encryption.

dev:type.maml:name: System.IO.FileInfo. Protect-File will return FileInfo with the SourceFile, Algorithm, Key, CipherMode, and PaddingMode as added NoteProperties

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example encrypts C:\secrets.txt using the key stored in the variable $key. The encrypted file would have the default extension of '.AES' and the source (decrypted) file would not be removed.
This example encrypts C:\secrets.txt with a randomly generated DES key. The encrypted file would have an extension of '.Encrypted' and the source (decrypted) file would be removed.

This example encrypts all of the files under the C:\Files directory using the key stored in the variable $key. The encrypted files would have the default extension of '.AES' and the source (decrypted) files would be removed.

maml:description.maml:para: Used by the update-thisscript function to delete the old version of the script, move the new version of the script to the same directory the old one was in, and launch the new version of the script. This command is for internal use only. Do not use.

Used by the update-thisscript function to delete the old version of the script, move the new version of the script to the same directory the old one was in, and launch the new version of the script. This command is for internal use only. Do not use.
The path to the script's parent directory
The name of the running script file itself.
The path to the script's parent directory
The name of the running script file itself.
Decrypts a file encrypted with Protect-File.
Decrypts a file using a provided cryptography key.
File(s) to be decrypted.
Cryptography key as a SecureString be used for decryption.
Specifies the block cipher mode that was used for encryption.
Specifies the type of padding that was applied when the message data block was shorter than the full number of bytes needed for a cryptographic operation.
Suffix of the encrypted file to be removed.
Removes the source (encrypted) file after decrypting.
File(s) to be decrypted.
Cryptography key as a String to be used for decryption.
Specifies the block cipher mode that was used for encryption.
Specifies the type of padding that was applied when the message data block was shorter than the full number of bytes needed for a cryptographic operation.
Suffix of the encrypted file to be removed.
Removes the source (encrypted) file after decrypting.
File(s) to be decrypted.
Cryptography key as a SecureString be used for decryption.
Specifies the block cipher mode that was used for encryption.
Specifies the type of padding that was applied when the message data block was shorter than the full number of bytes needed for a cryptographic operation.
Suffix of the encrypted file to be removed.
Removes the source (encrypted) file after decrypting.
Cryptography key as a String to be used for decryption.

dev:type.maml:name: System.IO.FileInfo. Unprotect-File will return FileInfo with the SourceFile as an added NoteProperty

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example decrypts C:\secrets.txt.AES using the key stored in the variable $key. The decrypted file would remove the default extension of '.AES' and the source (encrypted) file would not be removed.

This example decrypts C:\secrets.txt.Encrypted using DES and the key stored in the variable $key. The decrypted file would remove the extension of '.Encrypted' and the source (encrypted) file would be removed.

This example decrypts all of the files under the C:\Files directory using the key stored in the variable $key. The decrypted files would remove the default extension of '.AES' and the source (encrypted) files would be removed.

maml:description.maml:para: This function determines if the termination script is up-to-date by comparing the local script to the script hosted on the Microsoft teams sharepoint site. For internal use by the script only.
This function determines if the termination script is up-to-date by comparing the local script to the script hosted on the Microsoft teams sharepoint site. For internal use by the script only.
The admin account to login to office 365
The password for the office 365 admin account
The key used to when converting the password to a secure string
The path of the parent directory which contains the running script
The name of the running script file itself.
The admin account to login to office 365
The password for the office 365 admin account
The key used to when converting the password to a secure string
The path of the parent directory which contains the running script
